text: Glasgow is a city in Montana in the United States. It is the county seat of Valley County. About 3,200 people lived there in 2020. Glasgow was founded in 1887 as a railroad town. Both Amtrak and the National Weather Service have facilities in Glasgow that link the city to the surrounding region. Nearby Fort Peck Dam provides tourist business. ==References== Category:Cities in Montana Category:County seats in Montana Category:1887 establishments in the United States
title: Glasgow, Montana
